learning_outcomes.description: Communicate in spoken Japanese on course-related topics, using appropriate patterns, vocabulary, script, and culturally appropriate expressions.
Use patterns, grammar, and vocabulary taught in the course to communicate on new topics and ideas.
Develop strategies for managing comprehension and communication challenges.
Develop a range of independent strategies to support ongoing Japanese language learning.
Collaborate with a partner or group to produce spoken work in Japanese.

WEEK 2 - 2/03/2026

WEEK 3 - 9/03/2026

WEEK 4 - 16/03/2026

WEEKLY, IN-CLASS QUIZZES are held on Monday starting from WEEK 2.

Please note that the WEEK 10 quiz will be held on Wednesday due to the Monday public holiday.
assessments.task_description:
The In-Class Quizzes are based on the content covered in class and in the textbook. 

The tasks will be completed each week in the Workshop session, starting from WEEK 2.

Listening tasks will be included in theese quizzes, therefore students are expected to bring their own listening device.

This is a sequenced assessment with a total of 10 tasks. The best 7 results will be counted for a total mark.

Use of Generative AI & MT: This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.due_date:
15/04/2026

Orals are conducted in-person in the students' allocated tutorials during class in Week 7.
assessments.task_description:
The oral task will cover Lessons 8 and 9 inclusive. However, previous study of Japanese in JAPN1011 and JAPN1012 or equivalent will also be necessary to complete the task successfully. The task will involve pair work and there will be a set exercise to be performed based on activities conducted during class and set for homework.

Oral tasks will be conducted during both tutorials in Week 7. The Oral Task Rubric provides a summary of skill level expectations and how this assessed.

THIS IS NOT AN OPEN BOOK TASK.

In cases where a student is referred to the Integrity Officer for breaches of exam conduct or suspected cheating on any part of this assessment item, the entire assessment item will be under review.

Use of Generative AI & MT: This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.due_date:
27/05/2026

Orals are conducted in-person in the students' allocated tutorials during class in Week 13.
assessments.task_description:
The oral task will cover Lessons 10, 11 and 12 inclusive. However, previous study of Japanese in JAPN1011 and JAPN1012 or equivalent and lessons 8 and 9 in this course will also be necessary to complete the task successfully. The task will involve pair work and there will be a set exercise to be performed based on activities conducted during class and set for homework. Oral tasks will be conducted during both tutorials in Week 13. Oral Task 2 Rubric provides a summary of skill level expectations and how this assessed.

THIS IS NOT AN OPEN BOOK TASK.

In cases where a student is referred to the Integrity Officer for breaches of exam conduct or suspected cheating on any part of this assessment item, the entire assessment item will be under review.

Use of Generative AI & MT: This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

assessments.due_date:
29/05/2026 5:00 pm

Students are expected to complete the assigned weekly readings from WEEK 2 to WEEK 12.

A 200–250 word self-reflection in Japanese, drawing on these readings, is due 5pm, Friday of WEEK13.
assessments.task_description:
To demonstrate your active participation and engagement in this course, you will contribute weekly to your online reading practice task. Each week, from WEEK 2 to WEEK 12 you are expected to engage with the reading provided.

You are expected to do this outside class—but you must complete the task each week.

In WEEK 13, you will:

  • Write a short self-reflection about your reading in Japanese by reflecting on the tasks (200–250 words in Japanese).
  • Submit this with the reading tasks as your final assessment (checked for completion).

The reflection should include:

  • What reading challenges did you face?
  • How did your reading improve over time?
  • Which grammar/vocabulary are you now more confident using?
  • How has your kanji recognition improved?
  • What would you still like to improve?

Please note that while weekly engagement is expected, your completed tasks will be assessed holistically at the end of the semester.

Your tasks and self reflection will be evaluated based on the following criteria:

  1. Consistent weekly engagement, as shown by time-stamped completions throughout the semester.
  2. Completion of the tasks to fully correct level.
  3. Final reflection: timely submission of a well-structured, cohesive Japanese-language reflection (200–250 words).

Reminders:

  • Do not wait until the end to record everything! These are weekly tasks to help your Japanese grow gradually.
  • You are not graded on accuracy—just for completion and effort.

AI and MT Statement

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance. A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Access and submission of tasks and self-reflection via Blackboard link. Students are responsible for sharing their individual self-reflection with their teacher via Blackboard on due date.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.
